panels.description:
Number of unique users who were active within the preceeding 24h period.

Requires JupyterHub 3.1.
panels.title: Daily Active Users

panels.description:
Number of unique users who were active within the preceeding 7d period.

Requires JupyterHub 3.1.
panels.title: Weekly Active Users

panels.description:
Number of unique users who were active within the preceeding 7d period.

Requires JupyterHub 3.1.
panels.title: Monthly Active Users

panels.description: Number of user servers using a container image.
panels.title: Images used by user pods

targets.expr: histogram_quantile(0.99, sum(rate(jupyterhub_server_spawn_duration_seconds_bucket{app="jupyterhub", namespace=~"$hub"}[5m])) by (le))
histogram_quantile(0.5, sum(rate(jupyterhub_server_spawn_duration_seconds_bucket{app="jupyterhub", namespace=~"$hub"}[5m])) by (le))
histogram_quantile(0.25, sum(rate(jupyterhub_server_spawn_duration_seconds_bucket{app="jupyterhub", namespace=~"$hub"}[5m])) by (le))

panels.description: Attempts by users to start servers that failed.

targets.expr: sum(increase(jupyterhub_server_spawn_duration_seconds_count{status!="success"}[2m])) by (status)

panels.title: Server Start Failures

panels.description: % of disk space left in the disk storing the JupyterHub sqlite database. If goes to 0, the hub will fail.

targets.expr:
# Free bytes available on the hub db PVC
sum(kubelet_volume_stats_available_bytes{persistentvolumeclaim="hub-db-dir", namespace=~"$hub"}) by (namespace) /
# Total number of bytes available on the hub db PVC
sum(kubelet_volume_stats_capacity_bytes{persistentvolumeclaim="hub-db-dir", namespace=~"$hub"}) by (namespace)

panels.title: Hub DB Disk Space Availability %

panels.description:
Pods in a non-running state in the hub's namespace.

Pods stuck in non-running states often indicate an error condition
panels.title: Non Running Pods

panels.description:
% of disk space left in a shared storage volume, typically used for users'
home directories.

Requires an additional node_exporter deployment to work. If this graph
is empty, look at the README for jupyterhub/grafana-dashboards to see
what extra deployment is needed.
panels.title: Free space (%) in shared volume (Home directories, etc.)

panels.description:
User pods that have been running for a long time (>8h).

This often indicates problems with the idle culler
panels.title: Very old user pods

panels.description:
User pods using a lot of CPU

This could indicate a runaway process consuming resources
unnecessarily.
panels.title: User Pods with high CPU usage (>0.5)

panels.description:
User pods getting close to their memory limit

Once they hit their memory limit, user kernels will start dying.
panels.title: User pods with high memory usage (>80% of limit)
